evals.prompt: Write a Unity C# PlayerController MonoBehaviour script with WASD/arrow key movement, space bar jumping, and camera follow. The player uses a Rigidbody for physics.
evals.expected_output: A Unity C# MonoBehaviour script following the project's coding standards: _camelCase private fields, [SerializeField] for Inspector fields, [Tooltip] annotations, camera code in LateUpdate, physics in FixedUpdate, #region organization.
expectations: Physics/Rigidbody code is in FixedUpdate, not Update
Camera follow code uses LateUpdate, not Update
The class uses #region sections for organization (Inspector Fields, Private Fields, Unity Lifecycle, etc.)
Component references are cached in Awake() using GetComponent
Events unsubscribe in OnDisable to prevent memory leaks

evals.prompt: Create a ScriptableObject for storing weapon configuration data in Unity. The weapon should have a name, damage value, attack speed, range, and a sprite icon. Also show how to create and use it in a weapon system.
evals.expected_output: A Unity C# ScriptableObject class with [CreateAssetMenu] attribute, proper naming conventions, [Tooltip] annotations, and example MonoBehaviour usage.
expectations: The ScriptableObject class has [CreateAssetMenu] attribute with fileName and menuName
Public fields or properties use PascalCase
Fields have [Tooltip] annotations describing their purpose
Numeric fields use [Range] attribute where bounds make sense
The class name follows PascalCase convention
An example is provided showing how to use the ScriptableObject in a MonoBehaviour
